Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in South Zoo as h; c = a = 3; so h = 3 * c = 3 * 3 = 9. Define adult racoon in South Zoo as O; so O = 4. Define adult deer in South Zoo as C; so C = h - b = 9 - 3 = 6. Define total number of newborn animal children in South Zoo as s; H = C * a = 6 * 3 = 18; K = O * h = 4 * 9 = 36; s = H + K = 18 + 36 = 54. Define average number of newborn children per adult deer in Mayer Aquarium as p; D = s = 54; so p = 2 + D = 2 + 54 = 56. Define adult racoon in Mayer Aquarium as A; J = p = 56; so A = 1 + J = 1 + 56 = 57. Define adult deer in Mayer Aquarium as x; so x = 4. Define total number of adult animals in Mayer Aquarium as n; so n = A + x = 57 + 4 = 61. Answer: 61.

Define adult parrot in Hamilton Farm as Y; so Y = 2. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in Hamilton Farm as s; h = i + Y = 7 + 2 = 9; so s = h + x = 9 + 4 = 13. Define total number of newborn animal children in Hamilton Farm as v; y = Y * i = 2 * 7 = 14; Q = o * s = 4 * 13 = 52; v = y + Q = 14 + 52 = 66. Define adult eagle in Mayer Aquarium as R; D = v = 66; so R = 1 + D = 1 + 66 = 67. Define adult parrot in Mayer Aquarium as k; I = R - e = 67 - 4 = 63; so k = 1 + I = 1 + 63 = 64. Answer: 64.

Define elementary school in Oakbridge City as M; so M = E + Z = 6 + 3 = 9. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Oakbridge City as V; so V = k = 1. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Riverton City as t; N = B = 9; so t = 3 + N = 3 + 9 = 12. Answer: 12.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Pine Ridge as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define adult wolf in Maple Creek as L; M = x = x; so L = 2 + M = 2 + x = x + 2. Define average number of newborn children per adult fox in Maple Creek as e; so e = L + x = x + 2 + x = 2*x + 2. Define average number of newborn children per adult fox in Cedar Valley as T; U = e = 2*x + 2; so T = 3 + U = 3 + 2*x + 2 = 2*x + 5. Define average number of newborn children per adult racoon in Cedar Valley as k; D = T = 2*x + 5; so k = 3 + D = 3 + 2*x + 5 = 2*x + 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult wolf in Maple Creek as a; w = k = 2*x + 8; so a = 2 * w = (2) * (2*x + 8) = 4*x + 16. Define average number of newborn children per adult deer in Pine Ridge as s; so s = a + L = 4*x + 16 + x + 2 = 5*x + 18. Define adult fox in Cedar Valley as c; so c = s = 5*x + 18. Define adult deer in Maple Creek as I; so I = c + s = 5*x + 18 + 5*x + 18 = 10*x + 36. Define average number of newborn children per adult deer in Cedar Valley as S; R = I = 10*x + 36; so S = 4 * R = (4) * (10*x + 36) = 40*x + 144. We know S = 224, so we have 40*x + 144 = 224 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 40*x + 144 = 224. Move all terms to one side: 40*x - 80 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 40*x = 80. Divide both sides by 40: x = 80 / 40. Solution: x = 2. Answer: 2.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define adult eagle in South Zoo as i; so i = 2. Define adult owl in South Zoo as B; so B = 3. Define total number of adult animals in South Zoo as Z; so Z = i + B = 2 + 3 = 5. Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Jefferson Circus as A; so A = Z = 5. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Jefferson Circus as F; so F = 3. Define adult crow in Jefferson Circus as j; so j = B - i = (3) - (2) = 1. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Jefferson Circus as R; S = j = 1; so R = 2 * S = (2) * (1) = 2. Define adult owl in Jefferson Circus as J; so J = R = 2. Define adult parrot in Jefferson Circus as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of newborn animal children in Jefferson Circus as s; c = x * F = (x) * (3) = 3*x; D = J * A = (2) * (5) = 10; o = j * R = (1) * (2) = 2; G = c + D = 3*x + 10 = 3*x + 10; s = G + o = 3*x + 10 + 2 = 3*x + 12. We know s = 24, so we have 3*x + 12 = 24 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 3*x + 12 = 24. Move all terms to one side: 3*x - 12 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 3*x = 12. Divide both sides by 3: x = 12 / 3. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in South Zoo as N; so N = I = 8. Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Bundle Ranch as b; so b = N + I = 8 + 8 = 16. We know s = 102, so we have 3*x + 96 = 102 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 3*x + 96 = 102. Move all terms to one side: 3*x - 6 = 0. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Oakbridge City as v; b = W * O = (4) * (36) = 144; t = M * x = (36) * (x) = 36*x; v = b + t = 144 + 36*x = 36*x + 144. We know v = 252, so we have 36*x + 144 = 252 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 36*x + 144 = 252. Move all terms to one side: 36*x - 108 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 36*x = 108. Divide both sides by 36: x = 108 / 36. Solution: x = 3. Answer: 3.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Riverton City as J; so J = 3. Define culinarian school in Shoreline City as T; so T = J = 3. Define regional medical school in Riverton City as m; so m = T = 3. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Shoreline City as D; r = m = 3; so D = 3 * r = (3) * (3) = 9. Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Shoreline City as Y; so Y = 3. Define regional medical school in Shoreline City as P; so P = Y = 3. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Shoreline City as M; g = P * Y = (3) * (3) = 9; s = T * D = (3) * (9) = 27; M = g + s = 9 + 27 = 36. Define regional medical school in Ruby Bay as K; so K = M + J = 36 + 3 = 39. Define private middle school in Oakbridge City as e; so e = K - J = (39) - (3) = 36. Define average number of teachers per private middle school in Oakbridge City as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Oakbridge City as b; so b = e * x = (36) * (x) = 36*x. We know b = 144, so we have 36*x = 144 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 36*x = 144. Move all terms to one side: 36*x - 144 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 36*x = 144. Divide both sides by 36: x = 144 / 36. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.
